intro: Phyllagathis oligotricha, commonly known as the hairy phyllagathis, is a small shrub native to the rainforests of northern Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine, hairy structures. It produces small, white or pale pink flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Phyllagathis oligotricha is typically found in moist, shaded environments and is adapted to the humid conditions of its native habitat.
